setting.description: Display of feeds for this journal. Displayed on the About and the Submission pages.
setting.name: publication_fees

value.default: You should update this section to show any fees that your journal charges.

setting.description: URL of the Journal's Publisher.
setting.name: publisher_url

setting.description: Name of the Journal's Publisher. Displayed throughout the site and metadata.
setting.name: publisher_name

setting.description: Displayed on the About and Submission pages. You should update this to display the Journal's copyright requirements.
setting.name: copyright_notice

setting.description: Displayed on the Submission pages. You should update this to display the Journal's acceptance criteria.
setting.name: acceptance_criteria

setting.description: Displayed on the About and Submission pages. You should update this with an ordered list of submission requirements.
setting.name: submission_checklist

setting.description: System emails are sent From this address.
setting.name: from_address

setting.description: Email sent to editors when they are assigned to a submission.
setting.name: editor_assignment

value.default:
Dear {{ editor.full_name }},

You have been assigned as an editor to "{{ article.title }}" in the journal {{ request.journal.name }}.

If you are unable to be the editor for this article, please reply to this email.

You can view this article's data on the journal site.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to authors when they have submitted an article.
setting.name: submission_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.full_name }},

Thank you for submitting "{{ article }}" to {{ article.journal }}.

Your work will now be reviewed by an editor and we will be in touch as the peer-review process progresses.

Regards,

setting.description: Email sent to editors when a reviewer accepts or declines a review.
setting.name: review_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.editor.full_name }},

This is a notification that the reviewer {{ review_assignment.reviewer.full_name }} has responded to your review request for "{{ article.title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}. You can view more information on the journal site.

Regards,

setting.description: Email sent to editors when requesting revisions.
setting.name: request_revisions

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.full_name }},

We are requesting that you make some changes to your paper. Details of the changes required are below:

{{ revision.editor_note }}

You can access you revision here: {{ request.journal_base_url }}{% url 'do_revisions' article.pk revision.pk %}

Your revisions are due on {{ revision.date_due }}.

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to reviewers when they agree to undertake a review.
setting.name: review_accept_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.full_name }},

Thank you for agreeing to review "{{ article.title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}.

You can now access the manuscript and the review process at: {{ request.journal_base_url }}{% url 'do_review' review_assignment.id %}.

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to reviewers when they complete a review.
setting.name: review_complete_reviewer_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.full_name }},

Thank you for completing your review of "{{ article.title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}.

We are extremely grateful for the work of reviewers, which greatly enhances the quality of the journal.

Thank you again and regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to editors when a reviewer request is sent.
setting.name: review_request_sent

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.editor.full_name }},

This is a notification that the reviewer status on "{{ article.title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }} has been updated.

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to editors when a reviewer complete a review.
setting.name: review_complete_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.editor.full_name }},

This is a notification that the reviewer status on "{{ article.title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }} has been updated. You can view more information on the journal site.

Regards,

setting.description: Email sent to reviewers when they agree to undertake a review.
setting.name: review_decline_acknowledgement

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.full_name }}, 

Thank you for letting us know that you are unable to review "{{ article.title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}.

 We are most grateful for your time.

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to reviewers to request a review.
setting.name: review_assignment

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.full_name }},

We are requesting that you undertake a review of "{{ article.title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }}.

We would be most grateful for your time as the feedback from our reviewers is of the utmost importance to our editorial decision making processes.

You can let us know your decision or decline to undertake the review.

Regards,
{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to authors when an article is accepted.
setting.name: review_decision_accept

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.full_name }},

We are happy to inform you that your article, "{{ article.title }}", has been accepted in {{ article.journal.name }}. Thank you for submitting such a strong manuscript.

Peer review reports and feedback on the manuscript can be viewed at: {{ review_url }}.

We will be back in touch soon to discuss the next stages of production.


Regards,


{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to authors when an article is declined.
setting.name: review_decision_decline

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.full_name }},

We are sorry to inform you that "{{ article.title }}" has been declined in {{ article.journal.name }}.

You can view your reviews and feedback on the manuscript at: {{ review_url }}

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Email sent to reviewers when a review request is withdrawn.
setting.name: review_withdrawl

value.default:
Dear {{ review_assignment.reviewer.full_name }},

We are writing to let you know that the review request for "{{ article.title }}" in {{ article.journal.name }} has been cancelled.

We thank you for your time but your review is no longer required.

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: Notify the proofing manager that corrections are complete.
setting.name: author_publication

value.default:
Dear {{ article.correspondence_author.full_name }}

We are pleased to say that your article, "{{ article.title }}", is set for publication on {{ article.date_published|date:'Y-m-d' }} at {{ article.date_published|date:'H:i' }}.

You may want to consider one or more of the following in order to promote your research:

  • Email a link to your paper to colleagues
  • Write a blog post about your paper
  • Upload it to your institutional repository or a subject repository.
  • Add to Wikipedia where appropriate

Regards,

{{ request.user.signature|safe }}

setting.description: A set of generic guidelines that reviewers should follow whilst undertaking review for this journal.
setting.name: reviewer_guidelines

value.default:
Open Library of Humanities operates a two-stage, double-blind peer review process. The author and reviewer should be anonymous at all stages of the review. After accepting the invitation to complete the review of this article, please refer to the information set out below to assist you in your feedback. The peer review form is available above (section 5). You can also upload additional files containing further comments relevant to the review on this page:

General guide to aid the review:

1) General comments and summary of recommendation
Does the article fit within the scope of the journal? To read more on the journal scope, please visit https://www.openlibhums.org/

2) Content:
Please consider the originality, relevance and rigour of the submission and the author's depth of understanding of the issues being researched. Please comment on the adequacy of the author's referencing and whether or not the existing knowledge base has been explored and built upon. Please comment on methodologies used and their appropriateness, and the author's use of the evidential base. Does the conclusion reflect the argument in the main body text and bring something new to the debate?

3) Structure and argument:
Please consider whether the abstract summarises the arguments in a succinct and accurate way. Is the manuscript logically structured and do the arguments flow coherently? Is there enough reference to methodology in the introduction and are the arguments fully evidenced and substantiated? Does the introduction signpost the arguments in a logical way and does the conclusion adequately summarise them?

4) Figures/tables:
Please comment on the author's use of tables, charts, figures or maps their relevance in terms of illustrating the arguments and supporting the evidential base, the quality of the formatting and presentation.

5) Formatting: does the submitted file adhere to the general author guidelines listed for the journal? Are the citations and references formatted to house-style?

5) Language:
Is the text well written? Please comment on the quality of language and need for grammatical improvement

Provide comments and suggestions for improvement, if required, with additional references or possible clarification of arguments, etc. You can also add comments to the text of the article and upload your comments, if you see fit.
